channel.title: Nov
channel.description: Day By Day VA Family-Literacy Calendar

item.title: November Monthly Activities
item.description:
Books to Read!

• Pumpkin Soup by Helen Cooper
• Too Many Pumpkins by Linda White and Megan Lloyd
• How Many Seeds In A Pumpkin? by Margaret McNamara and G. Brian Karas
• The Runaway Pumpkin by Kevin Lewis and S. D. Schindler
• It's Pumpkin Day, Mouse! by Laura Numeroff and Felicia Bond
• Pumpkin Countdown by Joan Holub and Jan Smith
• Biscuit Visits the Pumpkin Patch by Alyssa Satin Capucilli and Pat Schories
• Pinky and Rex and the Perfect Pumpkin by James Howe and Melissa Sweet
• Fancy Nancy: Our Thanksgiving Basket by Jane O'Connor and Robin Preiss Glasser
• Pete the Cat: The First Thanksgiving by James Dean and Kimberly Dean
• Pinkalicious: Thanksgiving Helper by Victoria Kann
• The Great Thanksgiving Escape by Mark Fearing
• Five Silly Turkeys by Salina Yoon
• Turkey Trouble by Wendi Silvano and Lee Harper
• 10 Fat Turkeys by Tony Johnston and Rich Deas
• I Know An Old Lady Who Swallowed A Pie by Alison Jackson and Judy Schachner
• Thanksgiving For Emily Ann by Teresa Johnston and Vanessa Brantley-Newton
• Thanksgiving At the Tappletons' by Eileen Spinelli and Megan Lloyd
• A Plump and Perky Turkey by Teresa Bateman and Jeff Shelly
• Thanksgiving Mice! by Bethany Roberts and Doug Cushman
• One Little, Two Little, Three Little Pilgrims by B. G. Hennessy and Lynne Avril Cravath
• Run, Turkey, Run! by Diane Mayr and Laura Rader
• Thanksgiving At Our House by P. K. Hallinan
• Turkey Claus by Wendi Silvano and Lee Harper
• The Thanksgiving Chicken by JoAnn Gartin
• The Thanksgiving Bowl by Virginia Kroll and Philomena O'Neill
• Thanksgiving Tongue Twisters For Kids (Volume 6) by Riley Weber
• Happy Thanksgiving, Gus! by Jacklyn Williams and Doug Cushman
• Tango and Tilly's No Turkey Thanksgiving (Volume 1) by Jan Mader and Mellisa Stepp
• Missy and Lizzy . . . The Thanksgiving Coat by Elizabeth A. Hoadley and 5-Year-Old Kailee

Artwork by Murphy iREAD 2014 Summer Reading Program

Around VA

Check out Festivals and Events happening in November around the state.

  • Craftsmen's Classic Arts and Crafts Festival - Richmond
  • 2015 First Firday Holiday Art Walk - Martinsville
  • Tidewater Gun and Knife Show - Norfolk
  • Chantilly Holiday Big Flea Market - Chantilly
  • Fishersville Holiday Indoor Market and Yard Sale - Fishersville
  • 2015 Fredericksburg Gun Show - Fredericksburg
  • Northern Virginia Christmas Market - Chantilly
  • The Bodacious Holiday Bazaar - Hampton
  • Richmond Fall Gun Show - Richmond
  • Chantilly Holiday Gun and Knife Show - Chantilly
  • Chesapeake Holiday Craft Show - Chesapeake
  • Virginia Beach Christmas Market - Virginia Beach
  • Deltaville Holiday Market - Deltaville
  • Harrisonburg Gun Show - Harrisonburg
  • 2015 Hampton Holiday Gun Show - Hampton
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: November 30
item.description:
Sing a Song

Little Arabella Miller

Little Arabella Miller
Had a fuzzy caterpillar
(Tickle palm with two fingers)
First it crawled up on her mother
(Walk fingers up left arm)
Then upon her baby brother
(Walk fingers up right arm)
They said, "Arabella Miller!
(Walk fingers up over head)
Put away your caterpillar!"
(hide hands behind back)

Little Arabella Miller
Had a fuzzy caterpillar
First it crawled upon her brother
Then upon her dear grandmother
Gran said, "Arabella Miller,
How I love your caterpillar."

TumbleBooks

Lost and Found, Story 3: Yuki - Jim LaMarche

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Try This

It’s Family Story Time! Have your child make up a story about his or her favorite animal family.

Watch

Wheels on the Bus

Explore More

  • Little Red Riding Hood - Click the play button to hear this classic story read out loud!
  • American Family Stories - Listen to stories from people across the country and then tell your own family stories.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: November 29
item.description:
Sing a Song

This is My Family

Point to each finger as you sing the song!

This is my mother (thumb)
This is my father (pointer finger)
This is my brother tall (middle)
This is my sister (ring)
This is the baby (pinky)
Oh, how I love them all! (clap left hand over all fingers and hug)

Watch

Peep and the Big Wide World

Try This

Let your child pick out books for family members to read together.

TumbleBooks

I Love Saturdays y Domingos - Alma Floe Ada

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Explore More

  • Reading Tips From Kids - Kids have their say and tell what they like best about storytime.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: November 28
item.description:
The Old Woman Who Lived in a Shoe

There was an old woman who lived in a shoe
She had so many children she didn’t know what to do.
She gave them some broth and a big slice of bread
Kissed them all soundly and tucked them in bed.

Watch

Ball for Baby

Try This

Take a walk or go out somewhere as a family.

TumbleBooks

The Best Mariachi in the World - J.D. Smith

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Explore More

  • Let’s Be Trees - Here are some great ideas for getting the most out of a family walk.
  • Walking Games - Try some of these games next time you are on a family walk.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: November 27
item.description:
Community Helpers Song

Tune: Skip to My Lou

Firefighters help in many ways,
Putting out the fires everyday,
To keep us safe throughout the day.
Firefighters help us everyday!

Mail carriers help in many ways,
Picking up our mail everyday,
Sending our letters on their way.
Mail carriers help us every day!

Teachers help in many ways,
Reading with children everyday,
Teaching students throughout each day.
Teachers help us every day!

Policemen help in many ways,
Patrolling the streets everyday,
To protect us as we work and play.
Policemen help us everyday!

Watch

This is My Turtle

Try This

Help your child write a letter to a family member.

TumbleBooks

Jessie's Island - Sheryl McFarlane

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Explore More

  • Letter Address Practice Craft - Print the envelope template to practice writing addresses. Who do you want to write a letter to?
  • Letters to Arthur - Pick what you want to say to Arthur and he’ll write you a letter back!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: November 26
item.description:
A Very Nice Place

The fish lives in the brook
(palms together tightly and wiggle forward)
The bird lives in the tree
(bend forearms at elbows and extend them upwards, cup hands and spread them open)
But homes are the very nicest place
For a little girl (boy) like me.
(Point to self)

Watch

The Elephant Song

Try This

Have each family member draw a self-portrait.

TumbleBooks

Me Too! - Jamie Harper

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Explore More

  • Body Self-Portrait - Draw a self-portrait and make a frame for your picture!
  • Self-Portrait Puppets - Make a bag puppet that looks like you or a family member.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: November 25
item.description:
Sing a Song

Five Little Babies

One little baby
(hold 1 finger up)
Rocking in a tree.
(arms rocking motion)
Two little babies
(hold 2 fingers up)
Splashing in the sea.
(splashing motion with hands)
Three little babies
(hold up 3 fingers)
Crawling on the floor.
(fingers of one hand walking on other hand)
Four little babies
(hold up 4 fingers)
Banging on the door.
(knocking motion)
Five little babies
(hold up 5 fingers)
Playing hide and seek.
(cover eyes)
Keep your eyes closed tight, now, Until I say … PEEK!
(move hands from face)

Watch

Miki

Try This

Have each family member list one thing that makes he or she feel grateful.

TumbleBooks

Franklin Goes To School - Paulette Bourgeois

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Explore More

  • StoryCorps - Listen to stories and conversations from Americans around the country.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: November 24
item.description:
Sing a Song

Hello, Mr. Turkey

Hello, Mr. Turkey how are you?
Hello, Mr. Turkey, how are you?
With a gobble, gobble, gobble,
And a wobble, wobble, wobble.
Hello, Mr. Turkey, how are you?

TumbleBooks

Doors - Roxie Monro

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Try This

Talk to your child about the history and meaning of Thanksgiving.

Watch

Wild Turkey

Explore More

  • The First Thanksgiving - Learn more about how Thanksgiving started and what the first Thanksgiving looked like.
  • Talk like a Pilgrim - Listen to how the English Colonists talked in 1627. Can you say these phrases?
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: November 23
item.description:
Myself

On my face I have a nose,
And way down here I have ten toes.
I have two eyes that I can blink.
I have a head to help me think.
I have a chin and very near,
I have two ears to help me hear.
I have a mouth with which to speak,
And when I run I use my feet.
I have two arms to hold up high,
And here's a hand to wave GOODBYE!

TumbleBooks

Sink Or Swim - Valerie Coulman

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Try This

Trace the handprints of each family member and label them.

Watch

PBS Kids: Yesterday I Had the Blues

Explore More

  • Thanksgiving Craft Projects - Here are some great Thanksgiving crafts to share with your child.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: November 22
item.description:
Sing a Song

Baby’s Nap

This is a baby ready for a nap.
Lay him/her down on mother’s lap.
Cover him up so he won’t peep.
Rock him ‘til he’s fast asleep.

TumbleBooks

My Brother, The Knight - Laura Driscoll

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Try This

Have your child tell you a story about something he or she has done with another family member.

Watch

Sesame Street: Andrea Bocelli Sings a Lullaby to Elmo

Explore More

  • Storybird - Use Storybird to create a story with your family and friends that you can share.
  • Dinner Table Storytelling - Here is a great activity for the dinner table. Everyone can tell a story to enjoy.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: November 21
item.description:
Sing a Song

 

These are Grandma's glasses.
(Make "glasses" over eyes with fingers.)
This is Grandma's hat.
(Place hands close together over head.)
And this is the way she folds her hands
(Clasp hands together.)
And lays them in her lap.
(Place hands in lap.)

Watch

Tzaritza

Try This

Talk with your family about family traditions or create a new one.

TumbleBooks

The Fire Station - Robert Munsch

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Explore More

  • The Duck Song - This duck song is just for fun!
  • Start a New Family Tradition - Here are some great ideas for making new family traditions.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: November 20
item.description:
Sing a Song

Turkey

The turkey is a funny bird
Its head goes bobble-bobble;
And all he knows is just one word...
And that is
GOBBLE-GOBBLE!

TumbleBooks

Clever Beatrice - Margaret Willey

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Try This

Everyone in the family trace his or her hands to make the feathers for a turkey. Draw a family of turkeys for Thanksgiving.

Watch

Hand Turkey

Explore More

  • Don’t Grownups Have Any Fun? - The kids in this family think that they have lots more fun then their parents.
  • Tick Tock Turkey - Listen to these four stories about a time-traveling turkey!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: November 19
item.description:
Sing a Song

Mother Goose Poem

When little Fred went
to bed, he always
said his prayers.
He kissed mama and then
papa, and straightaway
went upstairs.

TumbleBooks

Bintou's Braids - Sylvianne Diouf

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Try This

Make paper plate faces. Draw pictures of everyone in the family, and decorate with yarn for hair. You can add straws to make them family puppets!

Watch

Sleepytime Rhyme

Explore More

  • Why Baby Sister Woke Up from Her Nap - A parent or older sibling can help read along with this story of a big family and a sleeping sister.
  • Paper Plate Crafts - Here are some other paper plate activities to make.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: November 18
item.description:
Sing a Song

Eat Them Everyday

Tune: Row Row Row Your Boat

Milk, milk, eggs and cheese
Fruits and vegetables
Meat and breads and cereals
Eat them everyday.

TumbleBooks

50 Below Zero - Robert Munsch

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Try This

Talk with your child about what kinds of foods are in the same family (food groups).

{mp3remote}http://www.archive.org/download/lovesongs_sv_librivox/love-songs_field_28_64kb.mp3{/mp3remote}

The Shut-Eye Train

Explore More

  • Foody Faces - Make a face made out of food. What will yours look like!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: November 17
item.description:
Sing a Song

Jumping Song

Tune: Farmer in the Dell

You are my sunshine.
We’re jumping up and down,
We’re jumping up and down,
We’re getting lots of exercise,
We’re jumping up and down.

Let’s bend and touch our toes,
Let’s bend and touch our toes,
We’re getting lots of exercise,
Let’s bend and touch our toes.

Let’s reach and touch the sky,
Let’s reach and touch the sky,
We’re getting lots of exercise,
Let’s reach and touch the sky.

We sit down on the floor,
We sit down on the floor,
When our exercise is done,
We sit down on the floor.

Watch

International I Love You Song

Try This

Make the world’s largest picture with your family. Use a roll of shelf paper or tape together many sheets of paper. Your child can start at one end and the whole family can help fill in the picture over several days.

TumbleBooks

Don't Forget to Come Back - Robie H. Harris

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Explore More

  • The Three Little Pigs - Click on the play button to hear this classic story read out loud.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: November 16
item.description:
Sing a Song

Grey Squirrel

Grey Squirrel, grey squirrel
Swish your bushy tail.
(have the children shake their imaginary tails)
Grey Squirrel, grey squirrel
Swish your bushy tail.
Wrinkle up your funny nose
(touch your nose with your finger and wriggle it)
Put a nut between your toes (pretend to do so)
Grey squirrel, grey squirrel
Swish your bushy tail.

TumbleBooks

Diary of a Spider - Doreen Cronin

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Try This

Help your child draw a picture of an animal home. Talk about different types of animal homes.

Watch

Three Little Pigs

Explore More

  • Picture Pairs - Match the animals to win the game!
  • Animal Homes - Can you pick the home for each animal?
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: November 15
item.description:
Sing a Song

This is the Way

Feel free to change the daily activities to match what your family does each day!

This is the way we wash our clothes
Wash our clothes, wash our clothes
This is the way we wash our clothes
So early Monday morning

This is the way we iron our clothes
Iron our clothes, iron our clothes
This is the way we iron our clothes
So early Tuesday morning

This is the way we mend our clothes
Mend our clothes, mend our clothes
This is the way we mend our clothes
So early Wednesday morning

This is the way we sweep the floor
Sweep the floor, sweep the floor
This is the way we sweep the floor
So early Thursday morning

This is the way we scrub the floor
Scrub the floor, scrub the floor
This is the way we scrub the floor
So early Friday morning

This is the way we bake our bread
Bake our bread, bake our bread
This is the way we bake our bread
So early Saturday morning

This is the way we go to church
Go to church, go to church
This is the way we go to church
So early Sunday morning

Watch

You Are My Sunshine

Try This

Ask your child to set the table and have him or her tell you who will sit at each place. You can make a heart for each place setting.

TumbleBooks

Boomer's Big Surprise - Constance McGeorge

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Explore More

  • Pasta Play - Here are lots of ideas for playing with dried pasta.
  • Place Setting Practice - Print out the colorful serving pieces for practice setting the table or other pretend play.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: November 14
item.description:
Sing a Song

Family

This is a family
(hold up one hand, fingers spread)
Let's count them and see,
How many there are,
And who they can be.
(count 1, 2, 3, 4, 5)

This is the mother
(touch pointer finger)
Who loves everyone,

And this is the father
(touch big finger)
Who is lots of fun.

This is my sister
(touch ring finger)
She helps and she plays,

And this is the baby
(touch little finger)
He's growing each day.

But who is this one?
(touch thumb)
He's out there alone,

Why it's Jackie, the dog,
And he's chewing a bone.
(wiggle thumb.)

TumbleBooks

Biscuit - Alyssa Satin Capucilli

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Try This

Play a game together as a family. If you don’t have a game, make one up!

Watch

Arthur Lost and Found

Explore More

  • Make A Memory Game - Make your own matching game with pictures you draw or print out from the computer.
  • DIY Ring Toss Game - You can make your own ring toss game with empty water bottles.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: November 13
item.description:
Sing a Song

Stand up Tall

Stand up tall,
Hands in the air,
Now sit down,
In your chair,
Clap your hands,
All around town,
Smile and smile,
And flop like a clown.

Watch

Helping Song

Try This

Celebrate family volunteer day. Can you spend time helping out a family member?

TumbleBooks

Helping Out is Cool - Ellen Feinman Moss

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Explore More

  • Family Guide to Volunteering - Find out how you and your family can work together to volunteer in your community.
  • FamilyCares Coloring Book - These coloring pages show how people in the community help one another.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: November 12
item.description:
Mother Goose Time!

Chook, Chook, Chook,
Chook, Chook,
Good morning, Mrs. Hen
How many chickens have you got?
Madam I’ve got ten.
Four of them are yellow,
And four of them are brown,
And two of them are speckled red,
The nicest in the town.

Watch

The Farmer in the Dell

Try This

Build a fort in the living room. Use your imagination to make a sofa, sheets, pillows, towels, and other household goods into play-time fun!

TumbleBooks

Bebe Goes Shopping - Susan Middleton Elya

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Explore More

  • How to Build an Indoor Fort - Here are some great ideas for making a great fort in the living room!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: November 11
item.description:
Good Morning

Good morning, good morning, good morning, now we’ll say,
Good morning, good morning; we’ll nod our heads this way.
Good morning, good morning, good morning, now we’ll say,
Good morning, good morning, we’ll wave our hands this way.
Good morning, good morning, good morning, good morning now we’ll say,
Good morning, good morning, we’ll throw a kiss this way.

Watch

Mother and Child

Try This

Have a family story time and read a book together. Have each person pick a favorite story.

TumbleBooks

Pet Peeves - Sarah Willson

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Explore More

  • Living Forever - Listen to this story of a storyteller and a young boy by Peter Reynolds.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: November 10
item.description:
Veterans, We Thank You

Tune: Three Blind Mice

Veterans,
Veterans,
We thank you,
We thank you.
For serving our country faithfully,
For fighting to save our liberties.
Oh, we thank you.
Oh, we thank you.

Watch

The National Anthem

Try This

Talk about Veterans Day. Explain what the word veteran means. Do you have any veterans in your family?

TumbleBooks

Starring Hillary - Kathy Carple

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Explore More

  • VA Kids - Learn about veterans, explore the American flag, and play games.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: November 9
item.description:
See My Family

See my family, see them all
Some are short and some are tall
Let's shake hands, how do you do
See them bow, how are you
Father, mother, sister, brother
And me. All polite to one another.

TumbleBooks

Bad For Them, Good For Me - Aaron Zevy

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Try This

Have your child name one thing that makes each member of your family special.

Watch

I’ll Love You Forever

Explore More

  • Little Red - Follow along with the story of Little Red and make your own choices for the storyline.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: November 8
item.description:
Sing a Song

My Pets

I have five pets
That I’d like you to meet
They all live on Mulberry Street.

This is my chicken
He comes running whenever I call.

This is my duckling
He says: Quack, quack, quack
As he shakes the water from his back.

Here is my rabbit, he runs from his pen
Then I must get him back again.

This is my kitten
Her coat is black and white
She loves to sleep on my pillow at night.

Here is my puppy who has lots of fun
He chases the others and makes them run.

Watch

{swfremote}http://www.kindersite.org/Content/Mr.%20Happy.swf{/swfremote}

Mr. Happy

Try This

Talk about the animals in your neighborhood and whether they are a part of a family.

TumbleBooks

The Bears We Know - Brenda Silsbe

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Explore More

  • Animal Families - Match the baby animals to their mothers.
  • Animal Babies and Animal Family Coloring Pages - Print and color pictures of animal families.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: November 7
item.description:
Mr. Turkey Went Out One Day

Tune: Yankee Doodle

Mr. Turkey went out one day
In bright sunshiny weather
He met Mr. Duck along the way
They stopped to talk together:
Gobble, gobble
Quack, quack, quack
Gobble, gobble
Quack, quack, quack
Gobble, gobble
Quack, quack, quack
And then they both went back
Quack!

TumbleBooks

Ma, I'm A Farmer - Michael Martchenko

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Try This

Write a poem about a family of turkeys.

Watch

Home Videos

Explore More

  • Make Way for Ducklings - Watch this Caldecott Medal award winning book about a family of ducks.
  • Turkey Tic Tac Toe - Play tic tac toe online with a turkey!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: November 6
item.description:
You Can Find it in a Book

Tune: If You’re Happy and You Know it

You can find in a book, if you look. (clap, clap)
You can find it in a book, if you look, (clap, clap)
You'll find stories that are fun.
You can learn about the sun.
You can find it in a book, if you look. (clap, clap)

TumbleBooks

Crab Moon - Ruth Horowitz

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Try This

Take time to read together. Visit the library if you can. Find three books about families to read together. Ask a librarian if he or she has any favorites!

Watch

Wild Ride!

Explore More

  • Books About Families - Here is a great list of books about families to find at your nearest public library.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: November 5
item.description:
We're a Happy Family

Tune: I’m a Little Tea Pot

I love Mommy, she loves me
We love Daddy, yes siree
He loves us and so you see
We're a Happy Family
Repeat using brother, sister, grandma etc.

TumbleBooks

Always - Alison McGhee

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Try This

Find objects in your home that start with the same letters as each family member's name.

Watch

Hair is a Thing that Grows on Your Head

Explore More

  • Lazy Mary - Listen to the music and sing along to this nursery rhyme.
  • My Funny Whatsit Thingummy Line Machine - What can you draw with this line machine? Try lots of different colors!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: November 4
item.description:
Monkey See, Monkey Do

Oh, when you clap, clap, clap your hands
The monkey clap, clap, claps his hands.

Monkey see, monkey do.
(Hands open, wave back and forth)
Monkey does the same as you.
(Point to self, point away from self)

Oh, when you stamp, stamp, stamp your feet
The monkey stamp, stamp, stamps his feet.

Here are some other verses to try:
Oh, when you jump, jump, jump up high…
And when you make a funny face…
And when you turn yourself about…

Watch

If You’ll Be Kind to Others

Try This

Cut out the pictures from yesterday and make them into puppets by taping them to popsicle sticks or straws. Put on a puppet show about your family.

TumbleBooks

Rip Squeak And His Friends - Susan Yost-Filgate

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Explore More

  • Cuddle Buddies - Decorate toilet paper rolls to make lots of animal friends!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: November 3
item.description:
Sing a Song

My Family

If you peek into my room at night
(stand on toes as if peeking)
My family you will see
(nod head)
They kiss my face and tuck me in tight,
(blow kiss)
Why? Because they love me!
(hug yourself)

TumbleBooks

Red is Best - Kathy Stinson

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Try This

Spend time with your child drawing pictures of the members of the family. Do some live nearby and others far away? Talk about the difference between near and far.

Watch

This is the Way

Explore More

  • Explore - Play with bubbles, look at things up close, listen to a story, make our puppets dance and more!
  • Paint to the Music - Try this activity today and have art time to the beat of a song.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: November 2
item.description:
Sing a Song

Have You Ever Seen a Mother

Tune: Have you ever seen a Lassie. (substitute "father", "grandma", "uncle" etc. for mother)

Have you ever seen a mother, a mother, a mother,
Have you ever seen a mother as special as mine.
To care for and love me
To help and to hug me
Have you ever seen a mother as special as mine!

TumbleBooks

Sally Dog Little - Bill Richardson

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Try This

Put on music and dance with the whole family.

Watch

Te Amo Bebe, Little One

Explore More

  • Red Light, Green Light - Play Red Light, Green Light and dance away!
  • Kid’s Public Radio - Listen to singalong songs and dance to the music.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: November 1
item.description:
Sing a Song

Skinnamarink

Skinnamarink-a-dinky-dink.
Skinnamarink-a-doo I love you
Skinnamarink-a-dinky-dink.
Skinnamarink-a-doo I love you
I love you in the morning and in the afternoon
I love you in the evening and underneath the moon
Skinnamarink-a-dinky-dink.
Skinnamarink-a-doo I love you.

Watch

The Dingles

Try This

Talk with your child about what family means to you. Have an older adult tell your child a story from his or her childhood.

TumbleBooks

Pop's Bridge - Eve Bunting

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Explore More

  • Scoot - Follow School throughout South Carolina, learning about the places and people of our state!
